topics.content: Large numbers are numbers with many digits that are used to count large quantities.
The place value system helps determine the value of each digit based on its position in a number.
Large numbers can be compared by first comparing the number of digits and then their place values.
Rounding off is used to approximate a large number to make it simpler.
An arithmetic expression is a combination of numbers and operations without an equal sign.
Operations are performed in a fixed order using rules such as brackets first, then multiplication and division, followed by addition and subtraction.
Brackets are used to group numbers and change the order of operations.
Decimal expansion shows numbers written using a decimal point to represent parts of a whole.
Digits after the decimal point represent tenths, hundredths, thousandths, and so on.
Addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division can be performed on decimal numbers.
A variable is a letter used to represent an unknown number.
An algebraic expression is formed using variables, numbers, and operations.
Evaluating an expression means finding its value for given values of variables.
Parallel lines are lines that never meet and remain the same distance apart.
Intersecting lines meet at a point.
When lines intersect, different types of angles are formed.
Number patterns help identify relationships between numbers.
Divisibility rules help determine whether a number is divisible by another number.
Numbers can be used creatively to solve puzzles and logical problems.

chapters.chapter: A Tale of Three Intersecting Lines

topics.content: A transversal is a line that intersects two or more lines at different points.
Corresponding angles are angles formed in matching positions when a transversal cuts parallel lines.
Alternate interior angles are angles formed on opposite sides of a transversal inside parallel lines.
A fraction represents a part of a whole.
Fractions can be added, subtracted, multiplied, and divided using standard methods.
Fractions are used to solve real-life problems involving parts and sharing.
